meanings.explanation: feeling or caused to feel uneasy and self-conscious

examples.english: He looked abashed and uncomfortable.
examples.chinese: 他看起来既窘迫又不自在。

examples.english: He was abashed at forgetting his wife's birthday.
examples.chinese: 他因忘了妻子的生日而感到羞愧。

examples.english: Your kindness quite abashed me.
examples.chinese: 你的好意令我很不安。

examples.english: Clare is abashed. "I'm sorry!"
examples.chinese: 克莱尔显得有些尴尬“不好意思，是我心急了。”

examples.english: Her kindness quite abashed me.
examples.chinese: 她的好意令我不知所措。

examples.english: I am abashed I can't do that.
examples.chinese: 不好心思，我恐怕没措施那样做。

examples.english: And their faces will never be abashed.
examples.chinese: 他们的脸必不蒙羞。

examples.english: He looked rather abashed at her criticisms.
examples.chinese: 她的批评让他看上去相当尴尬。

examples.english: Marius went off quite abashed, but delighted.
examples.chinese: 马吕斯很难为情，走了，但是心里相当高兴。

examples.english: Sam abashed by his father's words said nothing.
examples.chinese: 山姆听了父亲的一席话后，羞愧得说不出话来。

examples.english: He was abashed at forgetting his wife 's birthday.
examples.chinese: 他因忘了妻子的生日而感到羞愧。

examples.english: The man abashed at forgetting his wife 's birthday.
examples.chinese: 那人忘了他妻子的生日，感到局促不安。

examples.english: His boss's criticism left him feeling rather abashed.
examples.chinese: 老板批评了他，他感到有些难为情。

examples.english: Hindley descended more leisurely, sobered and abashed.
examples.chinese: 辛德雷从容不迫地下来，酒醒了，也觉得羞愧了。

examples.english: Nikki began to feel abashed by his praise of her beauty.
examples.chinese: 他赞美着尼基的美貌，使她羞得面红耳赤。

examples.english: The boy stood abashed as his mistakes were pointed out.
examples.chinese: 那男孩子的错被指出之后，满脸羞愧。

examples.english: Carrie came away wearily, somewhat more abashed for her pains.
examples.chinese: 嘉莉疲惫地走开了，悲痛之余更加感到难堪。

examples.english: "You said the first of the week," said Carrie, greatly abashed.
examples.chinese: “你是说星期一来的，”嘉莉很窘迫地说。

examples.english: You can apprehend to feel abashed about your personal affairs.
examples.chinese: 为自己的个人前程觉得迷茫。

examples.english: He glanced at Juliet accusingly and she looked suitably abashed.
examples.chinese: 他怪罪的一瞥，朱丽叶自然显得很窘。

examples.english: Hurstwood was greatly abashed. His eyes expressed the difficulty he felt.
examples.chinese: 赫斯渥大为窘迫。他的眼神表明他感到很难堪。

examples.english: In fact I love my mother but is always more abashed than an expression very much.
examples.chinese: 其实我很爱我的母亲但总是羞于表达。

examples.english: Today he suddenly realized all the mistakes he had made in the past and felt much abashed.
examples.chinese: 对于过去犯下的错误，他今天才猛省过来，惭愧不已。

examples.english: In London he and Charles Darwin were both abashed when introduced to each other as "great men".
examples.chinese: 他曾在伦敦有过一则趣事：有人介绍他和查尔斯·狄更斯相识，介绍人将他们两人誉为“伟人”，弄得两人尴尬不已。

examples.english: The fool abashed and began to ponder gloomily how he might put an end to these unpleasant rumours.
examples.chinese: 愚人感到羞愧，于是开始忧郁地思考他该怎样对这些令人不快的谣传做个了断。

examples.english: They laughed at order and at law , but the frown of power dejected, and the eye of wisdom abashed them.
examples.chinese: 他们嘲笑秩序和法律，但是强者皱眉，会使他们沮丧，在智者的目光下，他们会窘迫不堪。

translations.summary: ... abandon v. 放弃，抛弃 abashed adj. 局促不安的，羞愧的 abbreviate v. 缩写，缩短，使简略 ...
... 通“馈”(kuì)。饷,赠送〖giveasagift〗 羞惭〖ashamed;abashed〗 另见guī ...
abashed(羞愧的), 此释义来源于网络辞典。
... tense n. 时态 abashed adj. 不安的；窘迫的；尴尬的 languid adj. 倦怠的；呆滞的；软弱无力的 ...

words.translation: 使困窘；使羞愧；使局促不安

authoritative_sentences: Mr. Chiklis, 49, looked as abashed as a second-grader caught hurling chalk at the principal.
Monroe, lost, needs a pal, and young Colin, abashed yet persistent, keeps showing up in her dressing room.
Unfortunately, Joel is the autobiographical hero as abashed apologist, laying out and criticizing his experiences without exposing his core.
In his Brooklyn office, he interviews a rather abashed and puzzled Robinson, who was playing in the Negro Leagues at the time.
When I told them I didn't have any butter because people had bought up all there was in the stores, one of our friends confessed, looking a little abashed, that she had six packs at home.
But he was not abashed for long.

etymology.chinese: 前缀a-同ex-。-bash同词根bat, 拟声词，表示张嘴，窘迫，羞愧，同bashful.

definitions.explanation: If you are abashed, you feel embarrassed and ashamed. 窘迫的
